automate your mobile testing well if for those that have tried just doing manual

company creates more and more mobile apps you have different versions of those and patching those there's just so
much things you have to test so you're going to automate those because you have made you have limited QA resources my
particular team for this app is just has one QA resource and obviously that's not
enough to handle all these different devices so also another would be regression testing you know as you make
these new versions and you fix bugs you want to make sure you don't break anything that was there before that you
fixed before so you want to have all these sweet of automated UI tests that you can run so that every time you check
in you'll know that everything still works so that's regression testing and then for those manual tests that you do
have it's very possible that the QA person could make a mistake while you're going through the test plan may skip a
step or something that you know unexpected happens you want to avoid those manual mistakes so having an
automated UI test suite will give you more repeatable results then a big one
that actually these last two things really affected us hard which is where AWS device farm came in and helped out
is a Android and specifically you know Google makes a lot of changes to the Android operating system and in

you'll know what an activity is when one activity was talking to another activity they increase the security between those
that communication between the two activities and by increasing the security it broke our app so we had to
go back in and may add some extra code to make it backwards compatible so that'll work with the new secure way as
well as well as the way there was you know before they made that change so you may have to add code to be backwards
compatible so having the ability to test on all these different operating system versions will be able
to catch these types of things and the last one is differences in physical hardware so my product manager for
